Creates a using:
'NameClaimType': If NameClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call NameClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
'RoleClaimType': If RoleClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call RoleClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
Docs.returns: A with Authentication, NameClaimType and RoleClaimType set.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.SaveSigninToken : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the original token should be saved after the security token is validated.
Docs.remarks: The runtime will consult this value and save the original token that was validated.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the signature of the token.
Docs.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to signature of the token, instead of normal processing.

Docs.remarks: This will be used to decrypt the token. This can be helpful when the does not contain a key identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TokenDecryptionKeys As IEnumerable(Of SecurityKey)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that is to be used for decrypting inbound tokens.
Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to read the token.
Docs.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to read the token instead of normal processing.

Docs.summary: Gets or set the that store tokens that can be checked to help detect token replay.
Docs.remarks: If set, then tokens must have an expiration time or the runtime will fault.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the token replay of the token
Docs.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to validate the token replay of the token, instead of normal processing. This means no default token replay validation will occur. Even if is false, this delegate will still be called.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TryAllIssuerSigningKeys : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all should be tried during signature validation when a key is not matched to token kid or if token kid is empty.

Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the type of the token. If the token type cannot be validated, an exception MUST be thrown by the delegate. Note: the 'type' parameter may be null if it couldn't be extracted from its usual location. Implementations that need to resolve it from a different location can use the 'token' parameter.
Docs.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to validate the 'type' of the token, instead of normal processing. This means that no default 'type' validation will occur.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ValidAlgorithms As IEnumerable(Of String)
member this.ValidAlgorithms : seq<string> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the valid algorithms for cryptographic operations.
Docs.remarks: If set to a non-empty collection, only the algorithms listed will be considered valid.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateActor : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an actor token is detected, whether it should be validated.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateAudience : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the audience will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: Validation of the audience, mitigates forwarding attacks. For example, a site that receives a token, could not replay it to another side. A forwarded token would contain the audience of the original site. This boolean only applies to default audience validation. If is set, it will be called regardless of whether this property is true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateIssuer : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the issuer will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: Validation of the issuer mitigates forwarding attacks that can occur when an IdentityProvider represents multiple tenants and signs tokens with the same keys. It is possible that a token issued for the same audience could be from a different tenant. For example an application could accept users from contoso.onmicrosoft.com but not fabrikam.onmicrosoft.com, both valid tenants. A application that accepts tokens from fabrikam could forward them to the application that accepts tokens for contoso. This boolean only applies to default issuer validation. If is set, it will be called regardless of whether this property is true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateIssuerSigningKey : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that controls if validation of the that signed the securityToken is called.
Docs.remarks: It is possible for tokens to contain the public key needed to check the signature. For example, X509Data can be hydrated into an X509Certificate, which can be used to validate the signature. In these cases it is important to validate the SigningKey that was used to validate the signature. This boolean only applies to default signing key validation. If is set, it will be called regardless of whether this property is true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateLifetime : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the lifetime will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: This boolean only applies to default lifetime validation. If is set, it will be called regardless of whether this property is true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ValidateTokenReplay : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the token replay will be validated during token validation.
Docs.remarks: This boolean only applies to default token replay validation. If is set, it will be called regardless of whether this property is true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ValidTypes As IEnumerable(Of String)
member this.ValidTypes : seq<string> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that contains valid types that will be used to check against the JWT header's 'typ' claim. If this property is not set, the 'typ' header claim will not be validated and all types will be accepted. In the case of a JWE, this property will ONLY apply to the inner token header.
